1.name: Friendly Persuasion
1.description: The pacifist attitude of a Quaker family is tested as a result of the American Civil War.

2.name: Lust for Life
2.description: The life of brilliant but tortured artist Vincent van Gogh.

3.name: The Harder They Fall
3.description: An ex-sportswriter is hired by a shady fight promoter to promote his latest find, an unknown but easily exploitable rising star from Argentina.

4.name: The Ten Commandments
4.description: Moses (Charlton Heston), an Egyptian Prince, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

5.name: The Searchers
5.description: An American Civil War veteran embarks on a journey to rescue his niece from the Comanches.

6.name: Julie
6.description: A terrified wife tries to escape from her insanely jealous husband who is bent on killing her.

7.name: Forbidden Planet
7.description: A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has.

8.name: Giant
8.description: Sprawling epic covering the life of a Texas cattle rancher and his family and associates.

9.name: Around the World in 80 Days
9.description: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

10.name: The Killing
10.description: Crook Johnny Clay assembles a five man team to plan and execute a daring race-track robbery.

11.name: The Man Who Knew Too Much
11.description: An American physician and his wife take matters into their own hands after assassins planning to execute a foreign Prime Minister kidnap their son.

12.name: Somebody Up There Likes Me
12.description: Boxer Rocky Graziano's biopic, based on his autobiography, from childhood to his World Middleweight Championship title win at age 28 in 1947.

13.name: The Mole People
13.description: A party of archaeologists discovers the remnants of a mutant five-millennia-old Sumerian civilization living beneath a glacier atop a mountain in Mesopotamia.

14.name: Moby Dick
14.description: The sole survivor of a lost whaling ship relates the tale of his captain's self-destructive obsession to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.

15.name: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
15.description: A small-town doctor learns that the population of his community is being replaced by emotionless alien duplicates.

16.name: The King and I
16.description: A widow accepts a job as a live-in governess to the King of Siam's children.

17.name: Crime in the Streets
17.description: Social worker tries to befriend local slum gang.

18.name: War and Peace
18.description: Napoleon's (Herbert Lom's) tumultuous relations with Russia including his disastrous 1812 invasion serve as the backdrop for the tangled personal lives of two aristocratic families.

19.name: Suzaki Paradaisu: Akashingô
19.description: A couple stand indecisively on a bridge in Asakusa. Tsutae and Yoshiji have lost confidence and passion for their future as they get on the bus for Tsukishima and get off at Suzaki. Across ...                See full summary »

20.name: Love Me Tender
20.description: At the end of the Civil War, a Confederate team is ordered to rob a Union payroll train but the war ends leaving these men with their Union loot, until the Feds come looking for it.

21.name: Ghost Town
21.description: Under attack by Indians, passengers on a stagecoach reveal their true nature as the pressure mounts.

22.name: High Society
22.description: A spoiled heiress must choose among three suitors: her jazz musician ex-husband, a stuffy businessman, and an undercover tabloid reporter.

23.name: Et Dieu... créa la femme
23.description: In sunny St. Tropez, a young sexpot loves one brother but marries the other.

24.name: Patterns
24.description: When Fred Staples is recruited onto the board of a high-powered New York corporation, he finds his ethics and ambition at odds.

25.name: Bus Stop
25.description: A naive but stubborn cowboy falls in love with a saloon singer and tries to take her away against her will to get married and live on his ranch in Montana.

26.name: The Wrong Man
26.description: In 1953, an innocent man named Christopher Emmanuel "Manny" Balestrero is arrested after being mistaken for an armed robber.

27.name: Fire Maidens from Outer Space
27.description: A team of astronauts lands on a moon of Jupiter to find it populated with beautiful young women looking for mates. An old man explains to the explorers the group's story, as well as the moon's dangers.

28.name: Lost
28.description: When an 18 month old baby disappears in London, a police investigation ensues, though there are few leads.

29.name: The Conqueror
29.description: Mongol chief Temujin battles against Tartar armies and for the love of the Tartar princess Bortai. Temujin becomes the emperor Genghis Khan.

30.name: The Last Man to Hang
30.description: Sir Roderick Strood is on trial for the murder of his wife.

31.name: The Bad Seed
31.description: A housewife suspects that her seemingly perfect eight-year-old daughter is a heartless killer.

32.name: Un condamné à mort s'est échappé ou Le vent souffle où il veut
32.description: A captured French Resistance fighter during WWII engineers a daunting escape from a Nazi prison in France.

33.name: Trapeze
33.description: A crippled circus acrobat is torn emotionally between two ambitious young trapeze artists, one a talented young American and a less-gifted but beautiful Italian.

34.name: Anastasia
34.description: An opportunistic Russian businessman tries to pass a mysterious impostor as the Grand Duchess Anastasia. But she is so convincing in her performance that even the biggest skeptics believe her.

35.name: Baby Doll
35.description: A steamy tale of two Southern rivals and a sensuous nineteen-year-old virgin.

36.name: Written on the Wind
36.description: Alcoholic playboy Kyle Hadley marries the woman secretly loved by his poor but hard-working best friend, who in turn is pursued by Kyle's nymphomaniac sister.

37.name: The Fastest Gun Alive
37.description: In the western frontier town of Cross Creek storekeeper George Temple is a polite and soft spoken man with a secret past.When three bank robbers on the lam stop in town to change horses George Temple's past comes back to haunt him.

38.name: Comanche
38.description: Common efforts of the U.S. government and the Comanche nation to negotiate a peace treaty are sabotaged by renegade Indians and by the short-sighted Indian Commissioner.

39.name: Carousel
39.description: Fifteen years after his death, a carousel barker is granted permission to return to Earth for one day to make amends to his widow and their daughter.

40.description: In a totalitarian future society, Winston Smith (Edmond O'Brien), whose daily work is re-writing history, tries to rebel by falling in love.

41.name: Alexander the Great
41.description: The life and military conquests of Alexander III of Macedon (July 20/21, 356 - June 10/11, 323 B.C.), commonly known as Alexander the Great.

42.name: Now and Forever
42.description: A rich young society girl falls in love with a car mechanic. Her family is appalled and stops her seeing him. The girl attempts to commit suicide and then decides to elope.

43.name: Jacqueline
43.description: Captivating drama of a lovable little Irish girl and how she helps her tippler father find work.

44.name: Indestructible Man
44.description: Charles "The Butcher" Benton, a brutal death row inmate gets double-crossed by his crooked lawyer. He gets his chance for revenge when, after he's been executed, a bizarre experiment brings him back to life and more deadly than ever.

45.name: The Swan
45.description: Princess Beatrice's days of enjoying the regal life are numbered unless her only daughter, Princess Alexandra, makes a good impression on a distant cousin when he pays a surprise visit to ...                See full summary »

46.name: Earth vs. the Flying Saucers
46.description: Extraterrestrials traveling in high-tech flying saucers contact a scientist as part of a plan to enslave the inhabitants of Earth.

47.name: The Opposite Sex
47.description: Shortly after their tenth wedding anniversary, New York City Theater Producer Steven Hilliard (Leslie Nielsen) and his wife, former popular radio singer Kay Ashley Hilliard (June Allyson), ...                See full summary »

48.name: The Teahouse of the August Moon
48.description: In post-WWII Japan, an American captain is brought in to help build a school, but the locals want a teahouse instead.

49.name: A Kiss Before Dying
49.description: A ruthless college student resorts to murder in an attempt to marry an heiress.

50.name: The Girl Can't Help It
50.description: A gangster hires a down-and-out press agent to make his airheaded girlfriend a singing star.
